isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - REASSEMBLY

step1.para:
Mount the fuel filter header as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.47
.)

step2.para: Insert the header at the crankcase mounting pad. Fasten the header using the three mounting bolts and washers.
Tighten the fasteners to the standard torque (see Appendix).

note.para: Be sure to install the bellcrank or throttle spring bracket on the mounting bolts which attach the filter header.

step1.para:
(For MW Injection Pump) Install the fuel return hose to fuel return tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.48
.)

step2.para: Remove protective cap from hose and tube.
Install the clamps, washers, spacers and fuel return tube.

note.para: The mounting hardware is to be applied at the intake manifold stud (No. 4 cylinder position).

step1.para:
(For PES6A Injection Pump) Install the fuel return hose to fuel return tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.49
.)

step2.para: If removed, clip the fuel return line tee to the fuel leakoff hose and bolt the hose clamp to the cylinder block.
Reconnect the fuel return tube to the pump using new copper gaskets on the hollow screw at the banjo fitting.

figure.caption: Figure 11.47. Install the Fuel Filter Header.
Figure 11.48. Fuel Return Tube and Clamp Installation (Early Production).
Figure 11.49. PES6A Injection Pump Fuel Return Tube.

step1.para:
Connect the throttle return springs as shown in Figure 11.50
.

note.para: THE LARGE DIAMETER SPRING MUST BE INSTALLED IN THE TOP POSITION WHILE THE NARROW DIAMETER SPRING IS INSTALLED IN THE LOWER POSITION.

step1.para:
(For MW Injection Pump) Install the supply pump to final filter tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.51
).

step2.para: Remove the protective caps from the filter header and supply pump openings.
Install new rubber sealing sleeves at each end of the tube.
Tighten the connecting nuts at each end of the tube.

step1.para:
(For PES6A Injection Pump) Install the supply pump to final filter (pump outlet) tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.52
).

step2.para: Remove the protective caps from the filter header and supply pump openings.
Connect the banjo fitting at the supply pump using the hollow screw and two new copper gaskets.
Install a new rubber sealing sleeve and tighten the connecting nut at the filter header elbow.

figure.caption: Figure 11.52. PES6A Injection Pump Fuel Supply Lines.

step1.para:
(For MW Injection Pump) Install primary fuel filter to supply pump tube as follows: ( Figure 11.53
.)

note.para: Early style engines were equipped with a fuel inlet hose and flared elbows.

step2.para: Remove the protective caps from the filter header and supply pump openings.
Install new rubber sealing sleeves at each end of the tube.
Tighten the connecting nuts at each end of tube.

step1.para:
(For PES6A Injection Pump) Install the primary fuel filter to supply pump (pump inlet) tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.52
.)

step2.para: Remove the protective caps from the filter header and supply pump openings.
Connect banjo fitting at supply pump using hollow screw and two new copper gaskets.
Install a new rubber sealing sleeve and tighten the connecting nut at the filter header elbow.

step1.para:
(For MW Injection Pump) Install final filter to injection pump hose: (Refer to Figure 11.53
.)

step2.para: Remove the protective caps from the filter header and injection pump.
Tighten the connecting nuts to the filter header and injection pump elbows.
Fasten the clamp to the injection pump.

step1.para:
(For PES6A Injection Pump) Install the final filter to injection pump hose as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.52
.)

step2.para: Remove the protective caps from the filter header and injection pump openings.
Connect the banjo fitting at the injection pump using the hollow screw, bleed screw and two new copper gaskets.
Install a new rubber sealing sleeve and tighten connecting nut at filter header elbow.

step1.para:
Install the aneroid tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.54
.) (Engine Model D185F and Model D210F(w/Injection Pump 1 813 987 C91) are not equipped with an aneroid.)

step2.para: Remove the protective caps from the intake manifold elbow and the aneroid.
Install new rubber sealing sleeves at each end of the aneroid tube.

Tighten the connecting nuts at each end of the tube as shown in Figure 11.54
.

note.para: RE-USE OF OLD SEALING SLEEVES CAN CAUSE LEAKAGE, AFFECTING ANEROID OPERATION.

step1.para: Install fuel injection line assembly as follows:

note.para: PRIOR TO INSTALLING FUEL INJECTION LINE ASSEMBLY, CLEAN WITH FILTERED COMPRESSED AIR AND VISUALLY INSPECT FOR CONTAMINATION OR DAMAGE. REPLACE AS REQUIRED.

step2.para: Remove protective caps from the lines, nozzles and delivery valve holders at the pump.

Install the connector nuts at the nozzles using a 19 mm (3/4 in.) "Crow Foot" socket, as shown in Figure 11.55
. Tighten each nut to the specified "SPEClAL TORQUE".

note.para: Injection line fittings at pump and nozzle are frequently over tightened due to the fitting size of 19 mm (3/4 in.). This swedges the injection line, often partly closing the ends. This alters fuel delivery characteristics, raises injection line pressures and may cause performance problems or injection pump failure. Visually inspect the ends of the injection lines and replace any with swedged or damaged fittings or holes.

step2.para:
c. (For MW Injection Pump) Tighten the fuel injection line connecting nuts to the delivery valve holders at the pump. Tighten to the specified "SPEClAL TORQUE" using a 19 mm (3/4 in.)"Crow Foot" wrench at the connector nut. Refer to Figure 11.56
.

figure.caption: Figure 11.55. Install Injection Line Connector Nuts to each Nozzle.
Figure 11.56. Install Injection Line Connector Nuts to the Pump Delivery Valve Holders.

step2.para:
(For PES6A Injection Pump) Tighten the fuel injection line connecting nuts to the delivery valve holders at the pump. Tighten to the specified "SPECIAL TORQUE" using a 19 mm (3/4 in.) "Crow Foot" wrench at the connector nut while holding the delivery valve holder nut with a modified 12 pt. 22 mm (7/8 in.) wrench. Refer to Figure 11.57
. Do not allow the delivery valve holder to move.

note.para: Modify the 12 pt. 7/8 in. wrench by cutting a section wide enough to allow the injection pipe to pass so the delivery valve may be held.

figure.caption: Figure 11.57. Install Injection Line Connector Nuts to the Pump Delivery Valve Holders.

step1.para:
Install a new fuel filter as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.58
.)

step2.para: Lubricate filter gasket with clean diesel fuel.
Tighten until the gasket touches the filter header.
Tighten by hand an additional 1/2 turn.

note.para: Do not add fuel to the new filter.

step1.para: Install throttle cable or control rod linkage to the control lever and adjust linkage as specified in the current DT/DTA-466 operation and maintenance manual.
